name: There%27s_a_Girl_in_My_Soup
text:
There's a Girl in My Soup
There's a Girl in My Soup was a play performed by the Twin Peaks Timber Players.
Behind the scenes
There's a Girl in My Soup is a comedy written by Terence Frisby, which originally premiered in 1966. Its initial run ended in 1973, making it the longest-running comedy in West End.
